plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden flowers known for their dense, colorful blooms that signify autumn. They have a wide range of flower shapes and colors and are often used in floral arrangements and autumn decorations.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially East Asia, Europe, and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are symbols of longevity and rejuvenation in many Asian cultures and are often associated with the autumn festival season.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: This hardy wildflower produces bright yellow daisy-like flowers with dark brown centers. It thrives in prairies and open woods and is popular in gardens for late summer to fall color.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are the state flower of Maryland and are loved by pollinators like bees and butterflies.

plants.name: Nerine bowdenii
plants.description: A bulbous perennial native to South Africa, Nerine bowdenii produces clusters of delicate, lily-like pink flowers on leafless stems, blooming in autumn.
plants.location: South Africa; widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite the common name, the Guernsey Lily is not a true lily but belongs to the Amaryllis family.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub beloved for its glossy leaves and rose-like flowers that bloom in late fall through early spring, adding color during cooler months.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica was historically grown in Japanese tea gardens, and its petals were sometimes used as a tea flavoring.
